data.title: Saban Brands
data.meta_description: Saban Capital Group, inc., also known as SCG Power Rangers is an American investment firm founded by Haim Saban in 2010 as the successor to Saban Entertainment.[1] That same year, the firm started Saban Brands and bought the Power Rangers franchise back from Disney. data.text:
This page uses content from Wikipedia. The original article was at Saban Capital Group#Saban Brands. The list of authors can be seen in the page history. As with RangerWiki, the text of Wikipedia is available under the Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike License.

This article is about a/an production company in the Power Rangers franchise.

Saban Capital Group, inc., also known as SCG Power Rangers is an American investment firm founded by Haim Saban in 2010 as the successor to Saban Entertainment.[1] That same year, the firm started Saban Brands and bought the Power Rangers franchise back from Disney. Saban produced a new eighteenth season of Power Rangers that aired on Nickelodeon in Spring 2011 with the previous 700 episodes being rerun on Nicktoons.[2][3]

On May 1, 2018, Saban Brands sold the the Power Rangers franchise to Hasbro, along with many other assets they owned. As a result, Saban Brands closed down on July 2, 2018.[4]

Power Rider[]

During the run of Power Rangers Samurai in 2011, Saban Brands filed the trademark Power Rider, which some believed could have been future adaptions of Kamen Rider respectively. However, as of January 2014, the trademark has been abandoned. [5]

History[]

A press release by Saban Brands announced that their partnership with television station Nickelodeon and toy licensee Bandai America would be extended until 2016.

“Our partnership with Nickelodeon has been instrumental in maintaining the popularity of the Power Rangers brand and introducing the series to a new generation of kids,” said Elie Dekel, President of Saban Brands. The extension confirms additional seasons of original Power Rangers programming on Nickelodeon through 2016. [6]

This announcement was soon followed by the revelation of Power Rangers Dino Charge, an adaptation of Zyuden Sentai Kyoryuger which premiered in 2015.[7] On July 23, 2015, Saban announced that they had appointed Janet Hsu as their new CEO and President of Saban Brands, as Elie Dekel had stepped down from his position two weeks earlier to pursue new job prospects, though he will stay at the company as a senior advisor.[8] In January 2016, Saban Brands has renewed their partnership with Nickelodeon until 2018 and create the new season, Power Rangers Ninja Steel.[9] On February 12, 2018, Saban Brands renewed their partnership with Nickelodeon once again until 2021. [10] On May 1, 2018, Saban Brands sold the entire Power Rangers franchise and most other assets to Hasbro.

Saban Brands Ranger Series[]

Power Rangers Samurai (first half adaptation of Samurai Sentai Shinkenger)

Power Rangers Super Samurai (second half adaptation of Samurai Sentai Shinkenger)

Power Rangers Megaforce (first half adaptation of Tensou Sentai Goseiger)

Power Rangers Super Megaforce (second half adaptation of Tensou Sentai Goseiger & adaptation of Kaizoku Sentai Gokaiger)

Power Rangers Dino Charge (first half adaptation of Zyuden Sentai Kyoryuger)

Power Rangers Dino Super Charge (second half adaptation of Zyuden Sentai Kyoryuger)

Power Rangers Ninja Steel (first half adaptation of Shuriken Sentai Ninninger)

Power Rangers Super Ninja Steel (second half adaptation of Shuriken Sentai Ninninger)
